Package com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands

Interface IRule

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ICommand
    public interface IRule
extends ICommand

    To manually trigger a RULE, a message of class MsgExecute has to be sent to the bus.

    Author:
    Francisco Jos√© Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  IRule.IAction
      An action associated with a RULE.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      IRule.IAction addAction​(long delay, java.lang.String targetName, java.lang.Object valueToSet)
      Add a new Action at runtime if it did not existed yet.
      IRule eval​(java.lang.String deviceName, java.lang.Object deviceValue)
      Evaluates the rule if it is affected by the device.
      IRule.IAction[] getActions()
      Returns all existing actions for this rule.
      java.lang.String getIf()
      Returns the expression used to evaluate Rule's IF (null when RULE has no IF).
      java.lang.String getWhen()
      Returns the expression used to evaluate Rule's WHEN.
      boolean removeAction​(IRule.IAction action)
      Removes an existing Action.
      IRule trigger​(boolean force)
      This method evaluates the Rule and triggers its Actions if Rule When conditions are satisfied or unconditionally triggers the Rule when it is forced to do so.

      The Rule will not be triggered and an error will be reported if the Rule has Rule has errors. The Rule will not be triggered and an error will be reported if the Rule has an IF clause and parameter 'force' is false. The Rule will not be triggered if the Rule 'when' condition is not satisfied and parameter 'force' is false.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.ICommand

        name, start, stop

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        IRule eval​(java.lang.String deviceName,
           java.lang.Object deviceValue)
        Evaluates the rule if it is affected by the device.

        If WHEN clause is satisfied (the expression returns true), the IF clause (if any) will be evaluated.
        When no IF or IF is satisfied, all actions will be executed in same order as they appear in the command.

        This method is invoked every time an instance of MsgDeviceChanged arrives to the bus.

        Parameters:
        deviceName - Device's unique name (id).
        deviceValue - Device's new value.
        Returns:
        Itself.

      • getWhen

        java.lang.String getWhen()
        Returns the expression used to evaluate Rule's WHEN.
        Returns:
        The expression used to evaluate Rule's WHEN.

      • getIf

        java.lang.String getIf()
        Returns the expression used to evaluate Rule's IF (null when RULE has no IF).
        Returns:
        The expression used to evaluate Rule's IF (null when RULE has no IF).

      • getActions

        IRule.IAction[] getActions()
        Returns all existing actions for this rule.
        Returns:
        All existing actions for this rule.

      • addAction

        IRule.IAction addAction​(long delay,
                        java.lang.String targetName,
                        java.lang.Object valueToSet)
        Add a new Action at runtime if it did not existed yet.
        Parameters:
        delay -
        targetName -
        valueToSet -
        Returns:
        The new added action or null if the Action existed.

      • removeAction

        boolean removeAction​(IRule.IAction action)
        Removes an existing Action.
        Parameters:
        action - To be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the Action existed, false otherwise.

      • trigger

        IRule trigger​(boolean force)
        This method evaluates the Rule and triggers its Actions if Rule When conditions are satisfied or unconditionally triggers the Rule when it is forced to do so.

        • The Rule will not be triggered and an error will be reported if the Rule has Rule has errors.
        • The Rule will not be triggered and an error will be reported if the Rule has an IF clause and parameter 'force' is false.
        • The Rule will not be triggered if the Rule 'when' condition is not satisfied and parameter 'force' is false.
        Parameters:
        force -
        Returns:
        Itself.
